contentFreshness.assessment: Critical concern: 16 blog posts with unknown publication dates and zero content calendar entries indicate stagnant or undated content. Blog lacks fresh, seasonal, or timely updates. No evidence of regular publishing cadence (weekly, bi-weekly, or monthly). Missing current year context (we're in Feb 2026; no blog dates suggest content may be 1‚Äì3+ years old). This significantly impacts SEO performance, audience engagement, and brand credibility.
contentFreshness.recommendation: Immediately establish and publish a 12-month content calendar with clear publishing dates (recommend 2 posts/month minimum = 24/year). Prioritize 3 high-impact blogs in next 30 days: (1) compliance/DBS content for council procurement, (2) airport transfers positioning, (3) winter safety guide (seasonal relevance). Implement blog dating (publication & last-updated), add author bios, and integrate internal linking. Schedule bi-weekly LinkedIn posts and monthly newsletters to drive consistent traffic and engagement. Conduct content audit: verify which 16 posts are current, update outdated claims, and retire low-performing pieces. Use Google Search Console & analytics to identify high-intent keywords and prioritize content gaps.

overallAssessment:
AFJ has built a solid foundation of relevant, service-focused blog content addressing school transport, NEPTS, maintenance, and compliance‚Äîcritical topics for its B2B and B2C audiences. However, the portfolio suffers from three critical weaknesses: (1) no publication dates and zero content calendar entries suggest neglected or outdated content, damaging SEO and credibility; (2) significant gaps in high-ROI topics like council cost-benefit analysis, real case studies with metrics, and airport transfer positioning; and (3) underutilization of the 25-area geographic footprint and 700+ student/47-driver scale as marketing assets. The blog is broad but shallow, lacking the depth, specificity, and case-study evidence that councils and NHS trusts demand during procurement decisions.

Immediate actions: Implement a documented 12-month content calendar with 2 posts/month; refresh and date all existing blogs; prioritize 3 quick-hit pieces on DBS compliance, cost-saving case studies, and airport transfers; and establish a monthly newsletter cadence. Medium-term: develop 4‚Äì5 detailed case studies with quantified outcomes from existing council and NHS clients; create geo-targeted content for high-value service areas; and build thought leadership content around driver retention and transport sector challenges. This will position AFJ as a data-driven, compliant, strategically-minded partner‚Äînot just a transport operator.
